      • calculateDistance

        public static double calculateDistance​(javax.vecmath.Vector3d pos1,
                                       javax.vecmath.Vector3d pos2,
                                       boolean isGeodesic)
        Calculate the distance between two geographic points in 3 dimensions
        Parameters:
        pos1 - a 3-dimensional position in geo coordinates (decimal lat/lon/alt)
        pos2 - a 3-dimensional position in geo coordinates (decimal lat/lon/alt)
        isGeodesic - whether to calculate the distance with respect to an ellipsoid or using a straight line
        Returns:
        distance between pos1 and pos2 in meters

      • convertToEuclideanPoint

        public static javax.vecmath.Vector3d convertToEuclideanPoint​(javax.vecmath.Vector3d anchor,
                                                             javax.vecmath.Vector3d point)
        Convert a lat/long point to a euclidean point describing a position relative to another lat/long. Note that the conversion from degrees latitude to meters may be approximated as constant, but the conversion from degrees longitude to meters varies based on the latitude of a given point. Altitudes are not converted.
        Parameters:
        anchor - The origin, the lat/long which corresponds to a local euclidean value of (0, 0).
        point - The lat/long point to convert to local euclidean coordinates.
        Returns:
        The local euclidean equivalent of the point.

      • convertFromEuclideanPoint

        public static javax.vecmath.Vector3d convertFromEuclideanPoint​(javax.vecmath.Vector3d anchor,
                                                               javax.vecmath.Vector3d point)
        Convert a local euclidean point to a lat/long value, using the lat/long value of the origin of the local euclidean space.
        Parameters:
        anchor - The "origin" point, the lat/long which corresponds to a local euclidean value of (0, 0).
        point - The local euclidean point to convert to lat/long coordinates.
        Returns:
        The lat/long equivalent of the point.
